Docs.summary: Contains information about a part of the at a specified coordinate. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo> class, in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control, is used to determine which part of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control the user has clicked. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo> class contains the row, column, and part of the grid that was clicked. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestType> enumeration returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo.Type%2A> property for a complete list of grid parts.
To return a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo>, invoke the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown> event of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control. Pass the `x` and `y` properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown> event to return the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo> object. The row, column, and part of the grid are then printed.

remarks.format:

If the part of the grid has no function (such as the gray area behind a sparsely populated grid table), the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo.Nowhere> field is returned.
